meanings.definition: A channel or pipe for conveying water, typically elevated on a series of arches or towers.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Romans built aqueducts to transport water to their cities.
meanings.sent2: The aqueducts in the valley provided water to the entire village.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the aqueducts as a slide for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed through the conversation like aqueducts of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The image of the aqueducts against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A structure carrying a canal or flume across a valley or other gap.
meanings.sent1: The aqueducts spanned the river, allowing boats to pass underneath.
meanings.sent2: The aqueducts were engineering marvels of their time.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the aqueducts were bridges to a magical land.
meanings.sent4: His support was like the aqueducts, holding up the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The aqueducts stood tall, connecting the two sides of the valley.
